text: Is there a way to reliably set the contact for a user looking at a page? I'm building a little set of pages with Auth0 (<https://auth0.com/>) and after the user logs in I'd like to make sure their contact in HubSpot matches the Auth0 login so I can pull contact properties from HubSpot. I tried putting in a little hidden form and submitting that, but it doesn't really seem to set the contact.
I realize this is kinda janky, but this is a mostly internal thing so it doesn't need to be super perfect, just need to get it mostly working
Weirdly, in the form's inline message it _does_ show the contact from the submitted form, but elsewhere on the page it doesn't.

Okay I think I got an alternate solution. If you go to the page with `?email=(contact email)` in the URL, it will use that for your contact. So, I can print what HubSpot thinks the contact is to the page, compare that against the login email, and if they don't match redirect to the current page with that as the query. Then when that loads, the contact is correct, and I can just remove that from the URL. This has the downside of causing the page to refresh whenever they navigate to a new one if the contact isn't set without the query, but I guess that's fine
This may be a long shot, but does anyone know why my HubSpot CTA buttons are cutting in half on outlook?
Email template, I haven't run into this before.
Is the button an image, or is it using CSS for the background? Maybe an issue with top padding?
That's usually a line height thing I think
It is a button, but I believe it gets converted to an image when it is in an email?
Do you mind messaging me a link to the email that you’re working on?
Any fixes for outlook 2010/2013 so the email respects the max-sizing of the table?
